title: CSRF @ configuration

profile.name: Files.com
profile.about: Files.com is a unique cloud platform that empowers your data with tools for organization, collaboration, and file logistics.

vulnerability_information:
Enter the support PIN from your test site (if applicable): 
Enter the name of your test site (if applicable): gaming2
Enter the subdomain from your test site (if applicable): gaming2

Fill in the rest of your report below:
----
Greeting guys , 
i found a CSRF Bug at the configuration - > General form in all parameters 
the problem is in the "authenticity_token" parameter which is not properly set well , because it accept the null value which i bypassed it 
POC: 
1-generate a CSRF HTML form from the configuration -> general 
2-replace "authenticity_token" parameter value with null 
3-test it , it success 

POC CSRF FORM:
-------

activities.message:
Hi,

We are backlogged at the moment, but should clear through our tickets within the next week.

We do have multiple CSRF-related tickets, so we also want to make sure we address them in the order they were received.

Thank you,
—Michael

Thanks for your reply :)
waiting you no problem

Hi!

Thanks for submitting a report to our program.

Your report has been confirmed. We are still investigating the severity of the issue.

Sorry for the extreme delay in getting to this ticket. We'll be in touch soon.

—Michael

Thanks for your reply , i'm ready for any help upon your request , and please see the other report #208736 
Best Regards

Hi,

After investigattion this actually appears to be a false positive that occurs because of a bug in our code that causes confusion. We are paying the minimum $100 for the trouble this has caused, since that bug is our fault.

I will explain here what is going on so you can confirm for yourself. We have the CSRF token included in the form twice, and we have all been just editing or deleting the first copy. In HTML form submission, the second value is the one used, which was never edited or deleted, and thus form submission continued to work.

Please note that even your own example code above has the second CSRF token value included in the form data. All of us failed to see this until we dug deeper into the issue.

When editing the second CSRF value to be invalid, our testing showed that the submission was not accepted.

We will correct this bug in the near future so that we only send one copy of the CSRF token, although we do not yet know the reason why we are sending two copies, so we do hope the fix will be quick and not convoluted.

Thank you again for the report.

Cheers,
—Michael

Ah Okay , it happens , Thanks for the Bounty 
Best Regards :)
